content.description: Sit start with a pair of slopers. From there, place a heel, pull up to a left hand sloper, reach a right hand crimp, make a big move to an irregular right hand edge-pinch, follow to a vertical left hand mailslot, match on the edge above, then traverse right to a right hand sidepull, match a let hand next to it on a pinch, then stand up to right hand bump, and cruise up the remaining highly featured channel for the send.
content.protection: At least a few pads will work. The landing is great, but it does cover some ground and gets a bit high.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Dave Loves Donna.

content.description: Well, this is a pretty hairy line, but the movement is cool.  Start on the left side of the wall (next to "Dave".) on a crescent shaped hold.  Everytime I got on it, it would make a noise like it was going to break, but oh well.  Throw with your left hand to a small crimp then cross over to a side pull.  The last moves are weird.  Slap a small sloper to your left and then find a jug up high.  Don't fall here because there is a bad rock below you.  The ending is easy but high.  If any holds on here break, don't worry about it.  They're bound to sometime.  But it's worth a go.
content.protection: Bring many pads, I did it with one and I was scared.

content.description: This problem is a bit weird.  Start standing on a stack of pads or a rock lying around.  This is probably necessary unless you are 6'5".  With the left hand grab a small crimp and with your right hand grab the obvious sidepull above "loves."  The feet on this problem are non-existant.  The first move is a deadpoint to a three finger crimp with your left hand.  Either double on this crimp or throw high to a jug.  From here use your imagination to top out.  It is a little high and loose.
content.protection: The landing on this problem is fairly flat, but spotters are recommended.
